course_description: This course would provide students with an opportunity to examine, through major court opinions and briefs, the structure and substance of legal arguments, and how they, as legal counsel, would respond to law and religion issues in practice.
prerequisites: LAW 601B or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 5833, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 4:15-5:30p, Instructor: W. Barth, Status: Open
